Introduction to Data Governance


Roles, Responsibilities, and Key Terms


Overall Goals

  • Build shared understanding of:
    • What data governance is and is not.
    • What are the roles and responsibilities related to data governance?
    • Data governance is necessary.

What is data governance?

A process for defining, adopting, and enforcing strategies to monitor the collection, use, and management of an enterprise's data.
Data governance IS a form of distributed leadership.
Data governance IS a way to empower your office to make decisions about YOUR DATA.
Data governance IS a process that will help us to improve data quality and the decisions made from those data.
Data governance IS NECESSARY.

Data Governance IS NOT

  • a one-time process
  • the responsibility of a single program office
  • reinventing the wheel

What are the roles involved in Data Governance?

  • Data Owners
  • Data Stewards
  • Data Managers

Data Owners

  • Define access rules about your data (e.g., who should be able to view what data that you own)
  • Approve business rules for your data
  • Approve change requests from others related to your data
  • Submit change requests from others related to your data

Data Stewards

  • Maintain subject matter expertise about your data elements
  • Monitor regulatory and legislative requirements related to the collection, storage, and measurement of your data
  • Serve as the authoritative source of truth when there are questions related to your data
  • Interact with end users about questions related to your data

Data Managers

  • Implements your business rules in the data systems
  • Implements approved change requests
  • Monitors the data systems to ensure access is provided to approved users only
  • Works with data stewards to reconcile issues related to data quality assurance and quality control (QA/QC)
